justification: “Participants completed self-report questionnaires assessing fear (Fear Survey Schedule-III, FSS)….” – stating that the construct ‘fear’/‘fearfulness’ was assessed with the FSS-III measure.

measured_by: State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety (STICSA-T)
justification: The methods note that questionnaires included “trait anxiety (State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety, STICSA-T)” indicating STICSA-T operationalised trait anxiety.

measured_by: State-Trait Inventory for Cognitive and Somatic Anxiety – State version (STICSA-S)
justification: “Immediately before the VR game, participants … completed the state portion of the STICSA” showing STICSA-S was used to measure state anxiety.
The questionnaire battery lists “sensation seeking (Brief Sensation Seeking Scale, BSSS)” clarifying that the BSSS assessed sensation-seeking propensity.

measured_by: Disgust Propensity and Sensitivity Scale – 12 item version (DPSS-12)
justification: Methods state participants filled in “disgust (Disgust Propensity and Sensitivity Scale, DPSS-12)” establishing DPSS-12 as the instrument for disgust propensity/sensitivity.

measured_by: Spider Phobia Questionnaire – 12 item short form (SPQ-12)
justification: The scale list includes “spider phobia (SPQ-12)18”, linking the SPQ-12 to measurement of spider phobia.
Participants completed “snake phobia (SNAQ-12)18”, indicating SNAQ-12 operationalised snake-specific phobia.
The battery mentions “motion sickness (Motion Sickness Susceptibility Questionnaire, MSSQ)44,45”, showing MSSQ measured motion-sickness susceptibility.
They assessed “video game usage (Video Game Usage Questionnaire, VGUQ)46”, directly pairing the construct of game usage with the VGUQ measure.
“To ensure participants did not experience any negative symptoms from the VR, we measured their level of cybersickness … using the SSQ.” – SSQ is the instrument for cybersickness.
The authors report “the VRSQ scores were M_E1 = 12.2 , M_E2 = 12.7”, evidencing that VRSQ was used to quantify cybersickness.
They additionally provide “CSQ Dizziness … CSQ Difficulty focusing scores”, showing the CSQ-VR was another tool for assessing cybersickness.
Eligibility screening excluded anyone with PTSD symptoms “assessed using the PTSD Checklist for DSM-5 (PCL-5)” – thus PCL-5 measured post-traumatic stress symptoms.
